com.intel.fightclub.dialog.logging.xml.core

Class XmlLogPlugin<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.fightclub.dialog.logging.xml.core.XmlLogPlugin<E>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AppInfoXmlPlugin, AsrBreakpointXmlPlugin, AsrDialogXmlPlugin, AsrInfoXmlPlugin, AsrResultXmlPlugin, AudioMetadataXmlPlugin, DeviceInfoXmlPlugin, DialogAlarmXmlPlugin, ModuleXmlPlugin, UserXmlPlugin, WearableInfoXmlPlugin

    @NotThreadSafe
public abstract class XmlLogPlugin<E>
extends java.lang.Object
    Plugin for implementing discrete modules for writing to an XML file. The idea is that each class that extends this class contains its own logic for writing information to an XML file. Contains various helper methods for writing to XML.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public final void initialize(@NonNull
                             XmlLogSerializer xml)
        Readies the plugin for use.
        Parameters:
        xml - The XML serializer to write to.

      • writeComment

        @NonNull
public final XmlLogPlugin<E> writeComment(@NonNull
                                                   java.lang.String comment)
                                            throws java.io.IOException
        Writes out an XML comment.
        Parameters:
        comment - The comment to write out.
        Returns:
        An instance of this plugin for method chaining.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the initialize(XmlLogSerializer) method had not been called prior to this one.
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the XML could not be written.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the comment is null.

      • writeStartTag

        @NonNull
public final XmlLogPlugin<E> writeStartTag(@NonNull
                                                    java.lang.String name)
                                             throws java.io.IOException
        Writes out an XML start tag. There must be a 1-to-1 mapping of writeEndTag() calls and writeStartTag calls. Otherwise, runtime errors will occur.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the tag.
        Returns:
        An instance of this plugin so that method calls can be chained together.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the name is an empty string.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the initialize(XmlLogSerializer) had not been called prior to this one.
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the XML could not be written.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the name is null.

      • writeEndTag

        @NonNull
public final XmlLogPlugin<E> writeEndTag()
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes out an XML end tag. There must be a 1-to-1 mapping of writeStartTag(String) calls and writeEndTag calls. Otherwise, runtime errors will occur.
        Returns:
        An instance of this plugin so that method calls can be chained together.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the initialize(XmlLogSerializer) has not been called prior.
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the XML could not be written.

      • writeElement

        @NonNull
public final XmlLogPlugin<E> writeElement(@NonNull
                                                   java.lang.String tagName,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   java.lang.Object value)
                                            throws java.io.IOException

        Writes out an entire XML element. An element is composed of start & end tags and some text value in between. Only non-null and non-empty values will be written.

        This is the equivalent of calling writeElement(String, Object, boolean) with shouldCreateEmptyElement set to false.

        Parameters:
        tagName - The name of the tag.
        value - The value to write inside of the tag.
        Returns:
        An instance of this plugin so that method calls can be chained together.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the tag name is an empty string.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the initialize(XmlLogSerializer) has not been called prior.
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the XML could not be written.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the tag name is null.

      • writeElement

        @NonNull
public final XmlLogPlugin<E> writeElement(@NonNull
                                                   java.lang.String tagName,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   java.lang.Object value,
                                                   boolean shouldCreateEmptyElement)
                                            throws java.io.IOException

        Writes out an entire XML element. An element is composed of start & end tags and usually some text value in between.

        If shouldCreateEmptyElement is set to true, an empty XML element will be generated if the provided value is null or is an empty string. If set to false, no XML element will be generated if the provided value is null or an empty string.

        Parameters:
        tagName - The name of the tag.
        value - The value to write inside of the tag.
        shouldCreateEmptyElement - If true, an empty XML element is generated if no value is provided. If false, an XML element is not generated if a value is not provided.
        Returns:
        An instance of this plugin so that method calls can be chained together.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the tag name is an empty string.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the initialize(XmlLogSerializer) has not been called prior.
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the XML could not be written.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the tag name is null.

      • writeAttribute

        @NonNull
public final XmlLogPlugin<E> writeAttribute(@NonNull
                                                     java.lang.String name,
                                                     @Nullable
                                                     java.lang.String value,
                                                     boolean isRequired)
                                              throws java.io.IOException
        Writes out an attribute to the last XML start tag. Must be called after writeStartTag(String).
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the attribute.
        value - The value of the attribute.
        isRequired - If true, this method will validate that the attribute value is a non-empty string and throw an exception if it is not. Otherwise, the attribute is not written.
        Returns:
        An instance of this plugin so that method calls can be chained together.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the attribute is required but it was null or an empty string. Also thrown if the attribute name is an empty string.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the initialize(XmlLogSerializer) has not been called prior.
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the XML could not be written.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the attribute name was null.

      • writeText

        @NonNull
public final XmlLogPlugin<E> writeText(@NonNull
                                                java.lang.String value)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Writes text that goes between XML start and end tags.
        Parameters:
        value - The text to write.
        Returns:
        An instance of this plugin so that method calls can be chained together.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the XML could not be written.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the initialize(XmlLogSerializer) has not been called prior.

      • writeToXml

        public abstract void writeToXml(@NonNull
                                E arg)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Writes necessary information out into XML. Takes in a variable number of arguments which may contain necessary information that is to be written to the XML file.
        Parameters:
        arg - An object that has data necessary for writing out the XML file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an error occurred while writing the XML.
